title: World Trade Week, 2025
summary:
The document titled "World Trade Week, 2025" is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, declaring May 18 through May 24, 2025, as World Trade Week. The proclamation emphasizes a commitment to balanced and reciprocal trade, aiming to prioritize American workers and industries over globalist interests. Trump criticizes past trade practices that he believes have harmed American jobs and manufacturing.

Key actions mentioned include the implementation of reciprocal tariffs to protect American manufacturing and initiatives to train workers for future jobs. The proclamation also highlights the importance of new trade agreements, such as the recent deal with the United Kingdom, to enhance American competitiveness abroad.

Overall, the document reflects a strong "America First" approach, advocating for policies that bolster the economy and improve the lives of American workers, with a vision of achieving significant economic growth and national pride.
